item.title: Her Two "Best Friends" Took Her LIFE!
item.description: Skylar Neese was a 16-year-old girl from Star City, West Virginia, who disappeared from her home on July 6, 2012. Her body was found six months later in neighboring Pennsylvania. It was discovered that her best friends, Shelia Eddy and Rachel Shoaf, had lured her out of her house and stabbed her to death in a premeditated attack. Shoaf confessed to the murder, leading to Eddy's arrest. Both teens were convicted, with Shoaf receiving a 30-year sentence for second-degree murder and Eddy sentenced to life in prison for first-degree murder.

Her body was found six months later in neighboring Pennsylvania. It was discovered that her best friends, Shelia Eddy and Rachel Shoaf, had lured her out of her house and stabbed her to death in a premeditated attack. Shoaf confessed to the murder, leading to Eddy's arrest. Both teens were convicted, with Shoaf receiving a 30-year sentence for second-degree murder and Eddy sentenced to life in prison for first-degree murder.

item.title: This Case Left Jurors Horrified *BODYCAM*
item.description: Three-year-old Dwelaniyah endured weeks of cruelty before his tragic death in 2022. His mother, Christina Robinson, denied harming him but was found guilty and sentenced to life in prison. Do you believe justice for Dwelaniyah has truly been served?

item.description: This is not what we imagine when we talk about 14-year-olds. Not even old enough to drive, but the things he did runs my blood cold... What are your thoughts on this case?

item.title: CCTV Captured How Cold-Bloodedly He Did It All!
item.description: Grace Millane, a 22-year-old student from the UK, was traveling in New Zealand in 2018 when she disappeared after a date. Her body was later found in woodland near Auckland. A man she met through a dating app was convicted of her death. Do you think solo travel has become riskier today?

item.title: She Opened the Trunk, They Couldn't Believe What They Saw
item.description: On Monday, Feb. 10, Judge Nancy Purpura sentenced Nicole Johnson to life in prison, suspending all but 50 years.

item.description: He Was Cold & Calculated | Fueled by Jealousy

item.title: A Six-Day Nightmare - Peter Manfredonia
item.description: Peter Manfredonia is a former University of Connecticut student whose violent crime spree in May 2020 gained national attention. Over several days, he committed multiple acts of violence, including the murder of two men in Connecticut, the assault of another victim, and a kidnapping. His flight across several states sparked a multi-day manhunt that ended in his arrest in Maryland. Manfredonia’s case raised questions about mental health, campus safety, and early intervention, as friends and family noted he had struggled prior to the attacks. He was later sentenced for his crimes, bringing closure to grieving families.

item.title: He Picked the WRONG Victim to Mess With!
item.description: When an ex policeman' Gary lewis, was busy doing his daily work in his cool little record shop little did he know ow that Dareen Harris had a plan which was going to test his strength and resilience.

item.title: He Faked It All to Avoid FBI Investigation!
item.description: Nicholas Rossi, also known by multiple aliases, is a fugitive whose case has drawn widespread attention for its twists and deception. Wanted in the U.S. on charges including sexual assault and fraud, Rossi faked his own death in 2020 and fled abroad. He resurfaced in Scotland, where authorities discovered him hospitalized with COVID-19. Rossi attempted to convince officials he was a different man, even adopting an Irish accent and using a wheelchair, but fingerprint and tattoo evidence confirmed his identity. His extradition case has been marked by delays and bizarre courtroom behavior, making it one of the most unusual manhunts in recent years.

item.title: 11-Year-Old Played It Off to Survive
item.description: The murder of Kimberly Cates in Mont Vernon, New Hampshire, is remembered as one of the most shocking crimes in the state’s history. In October 2009, intruders broke into the Cates family home during the night in what they described as a “thrill kill.” Kimberly, a beloved mother and nurse, was brutally attacked and killed, while her 11-year-old daughter Jaimie was left severely injured but miraculously survived and later testified against the attackers. The senseless and random nature of the crime horrified the community, sparking conversations about youth violence, mental health, and justice. The perpetrators were swiftly caught and sentenced.

item.title: Hikers Met a Horrifying Scene in the Bushes❤️‍��
item.description: Liam Husted was a 7-year-old boy whose tragic death in 2021 shocked the nation. His body was discovered near a hiking trail in the Mountain Springs area, outside Las Vegas, initially without identification. For days, authorities referred to him only as “John Doe” until family friends recognized him from a police sketch and alerted investigators. Liam had lived in San Jose, California, with his mother, who was later arrested and charged with his murder. The heartbreaking case drew widespread attention, highlighting the importance of community awareness and swift action in missing children cases.

item.title: When A Neighbour Became The Prime Suspect��
item.description: When A Neighbour Became The Prime Suspect��

item.title: The Footage at the Gym Revealed What He DID to His Son!
item.description: Corey Micciolo, a 6-year-old from New Jersey, died in April 2021 after suffering blunt force injuries. His father, Christopher Gregor, was charged with murder after surveillance showed him forcing Corey to run on a treadmill as punishment. The case sparked outrage and calls for justice.

item.title: The Live-In Boyfriend Was Hiding a SECRET
item.description: Riley Crossman, a 15-year-old from West Virginia, vanished in May 2019. Days later, her body was found hidden under debris. Investigators discovered her mother’s boyfriend, Andy McCauley, had murdered her. He was convicted of first-degree murder, shocking the small Morgan County community.

item.title: Mum Tries to FRAME Her 2-Year-Old Son!
item.description: Yes, you read the title correct. Robin Howington told police the her daughter had been shot by a random stranger and then she blamed her 2-year-old son. I am speechless... - Em x

item.title: It Was Too Late to Save Little Xaqueline❤️‍��
item.description: The body cam footage is enough to break my heart. The neglect and abuse these kids have been through is beyond anything I can imagine... What do you guys think of this heartbreaking case? - Em x
